trans-unit.source: Partitioning Messaging Entities
trans-unit.target: Partitioning Messaging Entities

trans-unit.source: <token>sb1</token> employs multiple message brokers to process messages and multiple messaging stores to store messages.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb1</token> employs multiple message brokers to process messages and multiple messaging stores to store messages.

trans-unit.source: A conventional queue or topic is handled by a single message broker and stored in one messaging store.
trans-unit.target: A conventional queue or topic is handled by a single message broker and stored in one messaging store.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> now enables queues or topics to be partitioned across multiple message brokers and messaging stores.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> now enables queues or topics to be partitioned across multiple message brokers and messaging stores.

trans-unit.source: This means that the overall throughput of a partitioned queue or topic is no longer limited by the performance of a single message broker or messaging store.
trans-unit.target: This means that the overall throughput of a partitioned queue or topic is no longer limited by the performance of a single message broker or messaging store.

trans-unit.source: In addition, a temporary outage of a messaging store does not render a partitioned queue or topic unavailable.
trans-unit.target: In addition, a temporary outage of a messaging store does not render a partitioned queue or topic unavailable.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned queues and topics can contain all advanced <token>sb2</token> features, such as support for transactions and sessions.
trans-unit.target: Partitioned queues and topics can contain all advanced <token>sb2</token> features, such as support for transactions and sessions.

trans-unit.source: For more details about <token>sb2</token> internals, see the <link xlink:href="c62f062d-ba37-4fc4-85fe-81e40e40221c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Architecture</link> topic.
trans-unit.target: For more details about <token>sb2</token> internals, see the <link xlink:href="c62f062d-ba37-4fc4-85fe-81e40e40221c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Architecture</link> topic.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned Queues and Topics
trans-unit.target: Partitioned Queues and Topics

trans-unit.source: A partitioned queue or topic works as follows: each partitioned queue or topic consists of multiple fragments.
trans-unit.target: A partitioned queue or topic works as follows: each partitioned queue or topic consists of multiple fragments.

trans-unit.source: Each fragment is stored in a different messaging store and handled by a different message broker.
trans-unit.target: Each fragment is stored in a different messaging store and handled by a different message broker.

trans-unit.source: When a message is sent to a partitioned queue or topic, <token>sb2</token> assigns the message to one of the fragments.
trans-unit.target: When a message is sent to a partitioned queue or topic, <token>sb2</token> assigns the message to one of the fragments.

trans-unit.source: The selection is done randomly by <token>sb2</token> or by a partition key that the sender can specify.
trans-unit.target: The selection is done randomly by <token>sb2</token> or by a partition key that the sender can specify.

trans-unit.source: When a client wants to receive a message from a partitioned queue, or from a subscription of a partitioned topic, <token>sb2</token> queries all fragments for messages, then returns the first message that is returned from any of the messaging stores to the receiver.
trans-unit.target: When a client wants to receive a message from a partitioned queue, or from a subscription of a partitioned topic, <token>sb2</token> queries all fragments for messages, then returns the first message that is returned from any of the messaging stores to the receiver.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> caches the other messages and returns them when it receives additional receive requests.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> caches the other messages and returns them when it receives additional receive requests.

trans-unit.source: A receiving client is not aware of the partitioning; the client-facing behavior of a partitioned queue or topic (for example, read, complete, defer, deadletter, prefetching) is identical to the behavior of a regular entity.
trans-unit.target: A receiving client is not aware of the partitioning; the client-facing behavior of a partitioned queue or topic (for example, read, complete, defer, deadletter, prefetching) is identical to the behavior of a regular entity.

trans-unit.source: There is no additional cost when sending a message to, or receiving a message from, a partitioned queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: There is no additional cost when sending a message to, or receiving a message from, a partitioned queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Partitioning
trans-unit.target: Enabling Partitioning

trans-unit.source: To use partitioned queues and topics with <token>sb1</token>, use the Azure SDK version 2.2 or later, or specify <codeInline>api-version=2013-10</codeInline> in your HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: To use partitioned queues and topics with <token>sb1</token>, use the Azure SDK version 2.2 or later, or specify <codeInline>api-version=2013-10</codeInline> in your HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: You can create <token>sb2</token> queues and topics in 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 GB sizes (the default is 1 GB).
trans-unit.target: You can create <token>sb2</token> queues and topics in 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 GB sizes (the default is 1 GB).

trans-unit.source: With partitioning enabled, <token>sb2</token> creates 16 partitions for each GB you specify.
trans-unit.target: With partitioning enabled, <token>sb2</token> creates 16 partitions for each GB you specify.

trans-unit.source: As such, if you create a queue that’s 5 GB in size, with 16 partitions the maximum queue size becomes (5 * 16) = 80 GB.
trans-unit.target: As such, if you create a queue that’s 5 GB in size, with 16 partitions the maximum queue size becomes (5 * 16) = 80 GB.

trans-unit.source: You can see the maximum size of your partitioned queue or topic by looking at its entry on the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can see the maximum size of your partitioned queue or topic by looking at its entry on the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: There are multiple ways to create a partitioned queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: There are multiple ways to create a partitioned queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: When you create the queue or topic from your application, you can enable partitioning for the queue or topic by respectively setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnablePartitioning</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.TopicDescription.EnablePartitioning</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: When you create the queue or topic from your application, you can enable partitioning for the queue or topic by respectively setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnablePartitioning</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.TopicDescription.EnablePartitioning</codeEntityReference> property to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: These properties must be set at the time the queue or topic is created.
trans-unit.target: These properties must be set at the time the queue or topic is created.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to change these properties on an existing queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to change these properties on an existing queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can create a partitioned queue or topic in Visual Studio or in the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can create a partitioned queue or topic in Visual Studio or in the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new queue or topic in the portal, check the <ui>Enable Partitioning</ui> option in the <ui>Configure</ui> tab of the queue or topic window.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new queue or topic in the portal, check the <ui>Enable Partitioning</ui> option in the <ui>Configure</ui> tab of the queue or topic window.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, click the <ui>Enable Partitioning</ui> checkbox in the <ui>New Queue</ui> or <ui>New Topic</ui> dialog.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, click the <ui>Enable Partitioning</ui> checkbox in the <ui>New Queue</ui> or <ui>New Topic</ui> dialog.

trans-unit.source: Use of Partition Keys
trans-unit.target: Use of Partition Keys

trans-unit.source: When a message is enqueued into a partitioned queue or topic, <token>sb2</token> checks for the presence of a partition key.
trans-unit.target: When a message is enqueued into a partitioned queue or topic, <token>sb2</token> checks for the presence of a partition key.

trans-unit.source: If it finds one, it selects the fragment based on that key.
trans-unit.target: If it finds one, it selects the fragment based on that key.

trans-unit.source: If it does not find a partition key, it selects the fragment based on an internal algorithm.
trans-unit.target: If it does not find a partition key, it selects the fragment based on an internal algorithm.

trans-unit.source: Using a Partition Key
trans-unit.target: Using a Partition Key

trans-unit.source: Some scenarios, such as sessions or transactions, require messages to be stored in a specific fragment.
trans-unit.target: Some scenarios, such as sessions or transactions, require messages to be stored in a specific fragment.

trans-unit.source: All of these scenarios require the use of a partition key.
trans-unit.target: All of these scenarios require the use of a partition key.

trans-unit.source: All messages that use the same partition key are assigned to the same fragment.
trans-unit.target: All messages that use the same partition key are assigned to the same fragment.

trans-unit.source: If the fragment is temporarily unavailable, <token>sb2</token> returns an error.
trans-unit.target: If the fragment is temporarily unavailable, <token>sb2</token> returns an error.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the scenario, different message properties are used as a partition key:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the scenario, different message properties are used as a partition key:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>SessionId</embeddedLabel>: If a message has the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property set, then <token>sb2</token> uses the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property as the partition key.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>SessionId</embeddedLabel>: If a message has the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property set, then <token>sb2</token> uses the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property as the partition key.

trans-unit.source: This way, all messages that belong to the same session are handled by the same message broker.
trans-unit.target: This way, all messages that belong to the same session are handled by the same message broker.

trans-unit.source: This enables <token>sb2</token> to guarantee message ordering as well as the consistency of session states.
trans-unit.target: This enables <token>sb2</token> to guarantee message ordering as well as the consistency of session states.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>PartitionKey</embeddedLabel>: If a message has the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property but not the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property set, then <token>sb2</token> uses the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property as the partition key.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>PartitionKey</embeddedLabel>: If a message has the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property but not the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property set, then <token>sb2</token> uses the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property as the partition key.

trans-unit.source: If the message has both the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> and the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property set, both properties must be identical.
trans-unit.target: If the message has both the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> and the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property set, both properties must be identical.

trans-unit.source: If the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property is set to a different value than the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property, <token>sb2</token> returns an <embeddedLabel>InvalidOperationException</embeddedLabel> exception.
trans-unit.target: If the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property is set to a different value than the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property, <token>sb2</token> returns an <embeddedLabel>InvalidOperationException</embeddedLabel> exception.

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property should be used if a sender sends non-session aware transactional messages.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property should be used if a sender sends non-session aware transactional messages.

trans-unit.source: The partition key ensures that all messages that are sent within a transaction are handled by the same messaging broker.
trans-unit.target: The partition key ensures that all messages that are sent within a transaction are handled by the same messaging broker.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>MessageId</embeddedLabel>: If the queue or topic has the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.RequiresDuplicateDetection</codeEntityReference> property set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> and the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> properties are not set, then the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference> property serves as the partition key.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>MessageId</embeddedLabel>: If the queue or topic has the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.RequiresDuplicateDetection</codeEntityReference> property set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> and the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> properties are not set, then the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference> property serves as the partition key.

trans-unit.source: (Note that the Microsoft .NET and AMQP libraries automatically assign a message ID if the sending application does not.)
trans-unit.target: (Note that the Microsoft .NET and AMQP libraries automatically assign a message ID if the sending application does not.)

trans-unit.source: In this case, all copies of the same message are handled by the same message broker.
trans-unit.target: In this case, all copies of the same message are handled by the same message broker.

trans-unit.source: This allows <token>sb2</token> to detect and eliminate duplicate messages.
trans-unit.target: This allows <token>sb2</token> to detect and eliminate duplicate messages.

trans-unit.source: If the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.RequiresDuplicateDetection</codeEntityReference> property is not set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, <token>sb2</token> does not consider the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference> property as a partition key.
trans-unit.target: If the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.RequiresDuplicateDetection</codeEntityReference> property is not set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, <token>sb2</token> does not consider the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference> property as a partition key.

trans-unit.source: Not Using a Partition Key
trans-unit.target: Not Using a Partition Key

trans-unit.source: In the absence of a partition key, <token>sb2</token> distributes messages in a round-robin fashion to all the fragments of the partitioned queue or topic.
trans-unit.target: In the absence of a partition key, <token>sb2</token> distributes messages in a round-robin fashion to all the fragments of the partitioned queue or topic.

trans-unit.source: If the chosen fragment is not available, <token>sb2</token> assigns the message to a different fragment.
trans-unit.target: If the chosen fragment is not available, <token>sb2</token> assigns the message to a different fragment.

trans-unit.source: This way, the send operation succeeds despite the temporary unavailability of a messaging store.
trans-unit.target: This way, the send operation succeeds despite the temporary unavailability of a messaging store.

trans-unit.source: To give <token>sb2</token> enough time to enqueue the message into a different fragment, the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactorySettings.OperationTimeout</codeEntityReference> value specified by the client that sends the message must be greater than 15 seconds.
trans-unit.target: To give <token>sb2</token> enough time to enqueue the message into a different fragment, the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactorySettings.OperationTimeout</codeEntityReference> value specified by the client that sends the message must be greater than 15 seconds.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactorySettings.OperationTimeout</codeEntityReference> property to the default value of 60 seconds.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.MessagingFactorySettings.OperationTimeout</codeEntityReference> property to the default value of 60 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Note that a partition key “pins” a message to a specific fragment.
trans-unit.target: Note that a partition key “pins” a message to a specific fragment.

trans-unit.source: If the messaging store that holds this fragment is unavailable, <token>sb2</token> returns an error.
trans-unit.target: If the messaging store that holds this fragment is unavailable, <token>sb2</token> returns an error.

trans-unit.source: In the absence of a partition key, <token>sb2</token> can choose a different fragment and the operation succeeds.
trans-unit.target: In the absence of a partition key, <token>sb2</token> can choose a different fragment and the operation succeeds.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, it is recommended that you do not supply a partition key unless it is required.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, it is recommended that you do not supply a partition key unless it is required.

trans-unit.source: Advanced Topics
trans-unit.target: Advanced Topics

trans-unit.source: Using Transactions with Partitioned Entities
trans-unit.target: Using Transactions with Partitioned Entities

trans-unit.source: Messages that are sent as part of a transaction must specify a partition key.
trans-unit.target: Messages that are sent as part of a transaction must specify a partition key.

trans-unit.source: This can be one of the following properties: <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference>, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference>, or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: This can be one of the following properties: <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference>, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference>, or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: All messages that are sent as part of the same transaction must specify the same partition key.
trans-unit.target: All messages that are sent as part of the same transaction must specify the same partition key.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to send a message without a partition key within a transaction, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.
trans-unit.target: If you attempt to send a message without a partition key within a transaction, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to send multiple messages within the same transaction that have different partition keys, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.
trans-unit.target: If you attempt to send multiple messages within the same transaction that have different partition keys, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If any of the properties that serve as a partition key are set, <token>sb2</token> pins the message to a specific fragment.
trans-unit.target: If any of the properties that serve as a partition key are set, <token>sb2</token> pins the message to a specific fragment.

trans-unit.source: This behavior occurs whether or not a transaction is used.
trans-unit.target: This behavior occurs whether or not a transaction is used.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you do not specify a partition key if it is not necessary.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you do not specify a partition key if it is not necessary.

trans-unit.source: Using Sessions with Partitioned Entities
trans-unit.target: Using Sessions with Partitioned Entities

trans-unit.source: To send a transactional message to a session-aware topic or queue, the message must have the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property set.
trans-unit.target: To send a transactional message to a session-aware topic or queue, the message must have the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property set.

trans-unit.source: If the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property is specified as well, it must be identical to the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property.
trans-unit.target: If the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference> property is specified as well, it must be identical to the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference> property.

trans-unit.source: If they differ, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.
trans-unit.target: If they differ, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.

trans-unit.source: Unlike regular queues or topics, it is not possible to use a single transaction to send multiple messages to different sessions.
trans-unit.target: Unlike regular queues or topics, it is not possible to use a single transaction to send multiple messages to different sessions.

trans-unit.source: If attempted, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.
trans-unit.target: If attempted, <token>sb2</token> returns an <languageKeyword>InvalidOperationException</languageKeyword> exception.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Automatic Message Forwarding with Partitioned Entities
trans-unit.target: Automatic Message Forwarding with Partitioned Entities

trans-unit.source: <token>sb1</token> supports automatic message forwarding from, to, or between partitioned entities.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb1</token> supports automatic message forwarding from, to, or between partitioned entities.

trans-unit.source: To enable automatic message forwarding, set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.ForwardTo</codeEntityReference> property on the source queue or subscription.
trans-unit.target: To enable automatic message forwarding, set the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.ForwardTo</codeEntityReference> property on the source queue or subscription.

trans-unit.source: If the message specifies a partition key (<codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference>, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference>, or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference>), that partition key is used for the destination entity.
trans-unit.target: If the message specifies a partition key (<codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.SessionId</codeEntityReference>, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.PartitionKey</codeEntityReference>, or <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.BrokeredMessage.MessageId</codeEntityReference>), that partition key is used for the destination entity.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned Entities Limitations
trans-unit.target: Partitioned Entities Limitations

trans-unit.source: In its current implementation, <token>sb2</token> imposes the following limitations on partitioned queues and topics:
trans-unit.target: In its current implementation, <token>sb2</token> imposes the following limitations on partitioned queues and topics:

trans-unit.source: Partitioned queues and topics are only available via SBMP or HTTP/HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: Partitioned queues and topics are only available via SBMP or HTTP/HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: AMQP support will be added in the future.
trans-unit.target: AMQP support will be added in the future.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned queues and topics do not support sending messages that belong to different sessions in a single transaction.
trans-unit.target: Partitioned queues and topics do not support sending messages that belong to different sessions in a single transaction.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> currently allows up to 100 partitioned queues or topics per namespace.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> currently allows up to 100 partitioned queues or topics per namespace.

trans-unit.source: Each partitioned queue or topic counts towards the quota of 10,000 entities per namespace.
trans-unit.target: Each partitioned queue or topic counts towards the quota of 10,000 entities per namespace.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned queues and topics are not supported on <token>sb_onprem</token> versions 1.0 and 1.1.
trans-unit.target: Partitioned queues and topics are not supported on <token>sb_onprem</token> versions 1.0 and 1.1.
